intro: Jacquemontia linoides, commonly known as the creeping yellow vine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within the Convolvulaceae family.
